text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.

He put .......... in a basket?

Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.

Course ......... writers are to reflect local colour
explanation:
Course Material means any documentation, slides, hand-outs or other materials for a Course.
Option D ''Material'' is correct because the adverb ''writers'' is in plural form, hence the noun ''material'' can't be in plural form too. The statement would read;Course material writers are to reflect local colour

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.

The reason why he was not offered admission was ...... his results could not be found?

Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.

If you saw the photograph of the man ....... you be able to identify him?
explanation:
“If you saw the photograph of the man,wouldyou be able to identify him?”
In the sentence, a hypothetical situation is expressed. This is expressed with the use of "if" in the first clause. "would" and not "will" is used since the situation because it is a hypothetical situation and not something that actually happens. "would" and not "could" is used because the use of "could" would be redundant or unnecessary because the ability to identify "him" is already expressed with the use of "be able to".

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.

As Obande does not know anyone in this city, he hopes that some kind ........ will put him up for the night?
explanation:
''Man'' is the correct option.whenever ''some'' is used before a singular noun like man, It means that the person being talked about is unknown to d speaker. Hence we have.
As Obande does not know anyone in this city, he hopes that some kindmanwill put him up for the night?

Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.

The woman is one of the ........ of the society?
explanation: The word"elite"is a collective noun that refers to a group of highly distinguished or influential people. When referring to an individual who belongs to this group, we say:"She is one of theeliteof the society."

text:
Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.

Three quarters of the people in the village ....... killed but only half of their huts ......... affected?
explanation:
Were; is a second person singular past, plural past.
The speaker is reporting an event that had already happened, affecting multiple people and their residents.
Three-quarters of the people in the villagewerekilled, but only half of their hutswereaffected

explanation: The correct idiom is"to take the law into one’s own hands,"which means to take action or seek justice without resorting to the legal system or proper authorities.

''me neither'' is mostly used to assert or support a claim.
''A'' "I really don't care for strawberry ice cream." B: "Ugh, me neither!"A: "I wouldn't be caught dead wearing a dress like that." B: "Me neither."

Fill each gap with the most appropriate option from the list provided.

It is bad to take ........ property without permission?
explanation: "Someone else's" is the possessive form indicating ownership by another person. The correct construction for the possessive form is "someone else's," indicating that the property belongs to someone other than the person taking it. Therefore, option B, "someone else's," is the most appropriate choice to complete the sentence grammatically and convey the intended meaning.

text: Choose the option that has a different vowel consonant sound from the others.

Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

If he went to London, he would see the Queen?

options.A: He did not go to London and did not see the Queen
options.B: He would like to see the Queen when he goes to London
options.C: When he goes to London he will see the Queen
options.D: He did not see the Queen when he went to London

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

Ngozi has always considered her father to be an impassioned man?

options.A: Her father is a very strict man
options.B: Her father is a very lively man
options.C: Her father is an emotional man
options.D: Her father is a disciplined man

explanation: The most suitable option to explain the information conveyed in the sentence "Ngozi has always considered her father to be an impassioned man" is Her father is an emotional man. The term "impassioned" implies strong emotions or feelings, suggesting that Ngozi's father is characterized by his emotional nature rather than being strictly disciplined, lively, or a disciplinarian.

text:
Select the option that best explains the information conveyed in the sentence.

The manager paid us in hard currency?

options.A: We were paid in a strong and stable currency
options.B: We were paid in dollars and pound sterling
options.C: We were paid in new notes

explanation: A hard currency is a currency that is not likely to depreciate suddenly or to fluctuate greatly in value.

The agency has sworn to deal with all the apostles of confederation?

Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The members of the congregation were inspired by the sermon?

Choose the option opposite in meaning to the underlined word(s).

Gregarious animals can be found in the zoo.
explanation:
The term "gregarious" refers to the tendency of animals to be sociable, living in groups or communities. The sentence states that gregarious animals can be found in the zoo. This implies that these animals are comfortable being around others of their kind.
The opposite of "gregarious" is "lonely." If an animal is described as lonely, it means that the animal is isolated or lacks companionship, which contrasts with the sociable and group-oriented nature implied by "gregarious." Therefore, "lonely" is the most suitable opposite in this context.

They boys knew that storm was imminent?

Choose the option nearest in meaning to the underlined word(s).

The leader has the unstinting support of his party?
explanation:
The word "unstinting" in the given sentence means generous, wholehearted, or without reservation. It suggests that the leader receives strong and unequivocal support from his party.
Option C, "unsparing," is the closest in meaning to "unstinting" in this context. "Unsparing" also conveys the idea of not holding back or being generous and supportive, making it the most appropriate choice among the options provided. Options A, B, and D do not capture the positive and supportive connotation conveyed by "unstinting."

Choose the option that has the same stress pattern as the given word.

Typist

Choose the option that has the same stress pattern as the given word.

CEment?
explanation:
they are certain rules and exceptions to stressing a word. you need to first of all be able to differentiate between nouns, verb, adjectives, compound words etc. with the knowledge of this, you can easily  place the stress on the right syllable.
perfect is stressed asPERfect.
include is stressed as inCLUDE
interest is stressed as inTErest
employ is stressed at the second syllable as emPLOY
Therefore, perfect has the same word stress as cement on the first syllable.
NOTE; generally speaking words beginning with ‘un’ or ‘in’ have the stress on the second syllable.
